Trump beordret til å betale erstatning til New York
En dommer i New York har beordret president Donald Trump til å betale drøyt 18 millioner kroner i en tvist der han anklages for å ha misbrukt sin stiftelse.
07 Nov 2019, 19:28 by NTB-AP
Delstaten New York saksøkte i fjor sommer den veldedige stiftelsen Trump Foundation med anklager om at Trump og hans familie drev den ulovlig. Påstanden var at de misbrukte stiftelsen til å fremme egne interesser innen politikk og næringsliv.
– Politisk motivert
Torsdag ga dommer Saliann Scarpulla i New York også grønt lys til en avtale om å stenge Trump Foundation og fordele drøyt 15 millioner kroner som står igjen på stiftelsens konto, på andre veldedige stiftelser.
Nyhetsbyrået AP har bedt Trumps advokat om en kommentar til saken. Stiftelsens advokater har tidligere sagt at søksmålet er politisk motivert.
Meldte flytting
Sjefen for påtalemyndigheten i New York, Letitia James, mente presidenten måtte betale 25 millioner kroner i erstatning, men dommer Scarpulla kuttet beløpet til 18 millioner.
Trump kommer fra New York, men i høst meldte presidenten flytting til Florida. Det begrunnet Trump blant annet med at han er «blitt behandlet veldig dårlig av de politiske lederne i både byen og delstaten»

Trump ordered to pay compensation to New York
A New York judge has ordered President Donald Trump to pay just over $ 18 million in a dispute in which he is accused of abusing his foundation.
07 Nov 2019, 19:28 by NTB-AP
Last year, the state of New York sued the charitable foundation the Trump Foundation with accusations that Trump and his family were operating it illegally. The allegation was that they abused the foundation to promote their own interests in politics and business.
- Politically motivated
On Thursday, New York judge Saliann Scarpulla also gave a green light to a deal to close the Trump Foundation and distribute just over $ 15 million left in the foundation's account to other charities.
News agency AP has asked Trump's lawyer for a comment on the case. The foundation's lawyers have previously said that the lawsuit is politically motivated.
Reported move
New York prosecutor Letitia James believed the president had to pay $ 25 million in damages, but Judge Scarpulla cut the amount to $ 18 million.
Trump comes from New York, but this fall, the president announced his move to Florida. Trump's reasoning was that he had been "treated very badly by the political leaders in both the city and the state"
